Raag Raamkalee − Part 001 876 : 1 Raamkalee, First Mehl, First House, Chau−Padas: 876 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 876 : 3 Some read the Sanskrit scriptures, and some read the Puraanas. 876 : 4 Some meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and chant it on their malas, focusing on it in meditation. 876 : 5 I know nothing, now or ever; I recognize only Your One Name, Lord. ||1|| 876 : 6 I do not know, Lord, what my condition shall be. 876 : 7 I am foolish and ignorant; I seek Your Sanctuary, God. Please, save my honor and my self−respect. ||1||Pause|| 876 : 8 Sometimes, the soul soars high in the heavens, and sometimes it falls to the depths of the nether regions. 876 : 9 2

The greedy soul does not remain stable; it searches in the four directions. ||2|| 876 : 10 With death pre−ordained, the soul comes into the world, gathering the riches of life. 876 : 11 I see that some have already gone, O my Lord and Master; the burning fire is coming closer! ||3|| 876 : 12 No one has any friend, and no one has any brother; no one has any father or mother. 876 : 13 Prays Nanak, if You bless me with Your Name, it shall be my help and support in the end. ||4||1|| 876 : 14 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 876 : 15 Your Light is prevailing everywhere. 876 : 16 Wherever I look, there I see the Lord. ||1|| 876 : 17 Please rid me of the desire to live, O my Lord and Master. 876 : 18 My mind is entangled in the deep dark pit of Maya. How can I cross over, O Lord and Master? ||1||Pause|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 001 3

876 : 19 He dwells deep within, inside the heart; how can He not be outside as well? 876 : 20 Our Lord and Master always takes care of us, and keeps us in His thoughts. ||2|| 876 : 21 He Himself is near at hand, and He is far away. 876 : 22 He Himself is all−pervading, permeating everywhere. 876 : 23 Meeting the True Guru, the darkness is dispelled. −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 001 −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 001 4

Raag Raamkalee − Part 002 877 : 24 Wherever I look, there I see Him pervading. ||3|| 877 : 25 There is doubt within me, and Maya is outside; it hits me in the eyes like an arrow. 877 : 26 Prays Nanak, the slave of the Lord's slaves: such a mortal suffers terribly. ||4||2|| 877 : 27 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 877 : 28 Where is that door, where You live, O Lord? What is that door called? Among all doors, who can find that door? 877 : 29 For the sake of that door, I wander around sadly, detached from the world; if only someone would come and tell me about that door. ||1|| 877 : 30 How can I cross over the world−ocean? 877 : 31 While I am living, I cannot be dead. ||1||Pause|| 877 : 32 Pain is the door, and anger is the guard; hope and anxiety are the two shutters. 5

877 : 33 Maya is the water in the moat; in the middle of this moat, he has built his home. The Primal Lord sits in the Seat of Truth. ||2|| 877 : 34 You have so many Names, Lord, I do not know their limit. There is no other equal to You. 877 : 35 Do not speak out loud − remain in your mind. The Lord Himself knows, and He Himself acts. ||3|| 877 : 36 As long as there is hope, there is anxiety; so how can anyone speak of the One Lord? 877 : 37 In the midst of hope, remain untouched by hope; then, O Nanak, you shall meet the One Lord. ||4|| 877 : 38 In this way, you shall cross over the world−ocean. 877 : 39 This is the way to remain dead while yet alive. ||1||Second Pause||3|| 877 : 40 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 877 : 41 Awareness of the Shabad and the Teachings is my horn; the people hear the sound of its vibrations. Raag Raamkalee − Part 002 6

877 : 42 Honor is my begging−bowl, and the Naam, the Name of the Lord, is the charity I receive. ||1|| 877 : 43 O Baba, Gorakh is the Lord of the Universe; He is always awake and aware. 877 : 44 He alone is Gorakh, who sustains the earth; He created it in an instant. ||1||Pause|| 877 : 45 Binding together water and air, He infused the breath of life into the body, and made the lamps of the sun and the moon. 877 : 46 To die and to live, He gave us the earth, but we have forgotten these blessings. ||2|| 877 : 47 There are so many Siddhas, seekers, Yogis, wandering pilgrims, spiritual teachers and good people. 877 : 48 If I meet them, I chant the Lord's Praises, and then, my mind serves Him. ||3|| 877 : 49 Paper and salt, protected by ghee, remain untouched by water, as the lotus remains unaffected in water. 877 : 50 Those who meet with such devotees, O servant Nanak − what can death do to them? ||4||4|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 002 7

877 : 51 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 877 : 52 Listen, Machhindra, to what Nanak says. 877 : 53 One who subdues the five passions does not waver. 877 : 54 One who practices Yoga in such a way, 877 : 55 saves himself, and saves all his generations. ||1|| 877 : 56 He alone is a hermit, who attains such understanding. 877 : 57 Day and night, he remains absorbed in deepest Samaadhi. ||1||Pause|| 877 : 58 He begs for loving devotion to the Lord, and lives in the Fear of God. 877 : 59 He is satisfied, with the priceless gift of contentment. 877 : 60 Becoming the embodiment of meditation, he attains the true Yogic posture. Raag Raamkalee − Part 002 8

877 : 61 He focuses his consciousness in the deep trance of the True Name. ||2|| 877 : 62 Nanak chants the Ambrosial Bani. 877 : 63 Listen, O Machhindra: this is the insignia of the true hermit. 877 : 64 One who, in the midst of hope, remains untouched by hope, 877 : 65 shall truly find the Creator Lord. ||3|| 877 : 66 Prays Nanak, I share the mysterious secrets of God. 877 : 67 The Guru and His disciple are joined together! 877 : 68 One who eats this food, this medicine of the Teachings, −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 002 −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 002 9

Raag Raamkalee − Part 003 878 : 69 has the wisdom of the six Shaastras. ||4||5|| 878 : 70 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 878 : 71 My boat is wobbly and unsteady; it is filled with sins. The wind is rising − what if it tips over? 878 : 72 As sunmukh, I have turned to the Guru; O my Perfect Master; please be sure to bless me with Your glorious greatness. ||1|| 878 : 73 O Guru, my Saving Grace, please carry me across the world−ocean. 878 : 74 Bless me with devotion to the perfect, imperishable Lord God; I am a sacrifice to You. ||1||Pause|| 878 : 75 He alone is a Siddha, a seeker, a Yogi, a wandering pilgrim, who meditates on the One Perfect Lord. 878 : 76 Touching the feet of the Lord Master, they are emancipated; they come to receive the Word of the Teachings. ||2|| 878 : 77 10

I know nothing of charity, meditation, self−discipline or religious rituals; I only chant Your Name, God. 878 : 78 Nanak has met the Guru, the Transcendent Lord God; through the True Word of His Shabad, he is set free. ||3||6|| 878 : 79 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 878 : 80 Focus your consciousness in deep absorption on the Lord. 878 : 81 Make your body a raft, to cross over. 878 : 82 Deep within is the fire of desire; keep it in check. 878 : 83 Day and night, that lamp shall burn unceasingly. ||1|| 878 : 84 Float such a lamp upon the water; 878 : 85 this lamp will bring total understanding. ||1||Pause|| 878 : 86 This understanding is good clay; Raag Raamkalee − Part 003 11

878 : 87 a lamp made of such clay is acceptable to the Lord. 878 : 88 So shape this lamp on the wheel of good actions. 878 : 89 In this world and in the next, this lamp shall be with you. ||2|| 878 : 90 When He Himself grants His Grace, 878 : 91 then, as Gurmukh, one may understand Him. 878 : 92 Within the heart, this lamp is permanently lit. 878 : 93 It is not extinguished by water or wind. 878 : 94 Such a lamp will carry you across the water. ||3|| 878 : 95 Wind does not shake it, or put it out. 878 : 96 Its light reveals the Divine Throne. Raag Raamkalee − Part 003 12

878 : 97 The Kh'shaatriyas, Brahmins, Soodras and Vaishyas 878 : 98 cannot find its value, even by thousands of calculations. 878 : 99 If any of them lights such a lamp, 878 : 100 O Nanak, he is emancipated. ||4||7|| 878 : 101 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 878 : 102 To place one's faith in Your Name, Lord, is true worship. 878 : 103 With an offering of Truth, one obtains a place to sit. 878 : 104 If a prayer is offered with truth and contentment, 878 : 105 the Lord will hear it, and call him in to sit by Him. ||1|| 878 : 106 O Nanak, no one returns empty−handed; Raag Raamkalee − Part 003 13

878 : 107 such is the Court of the True Lord. ||1||Pause|| 878 : 108 The treasure I seek is the gift of Your Grace. 878 : 109 Please bless this humble beggar − this is what I seek. 878 : 110 Please, pour Your Love into the cup of my heart. 878 : 111 This is Your pre−determined value. ||2|| 878 : 112 The One who created everything, does everything. 878 : 113 He Himself appraises His own value. 878 : 114 The Sovereign Lord King becomes manifest to the Gurmukh. 878 : 115 He does not come, and He does not go. ||3|| 878 : 116 People curse at the beggar; by begging, he does not receive honor. Raag Raamkalee − Part 003 14

878 : 117 O Lord, You inspire me to speak Your Words, and tell the Story of Your Court. ||4||8|| 878 : 118 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 878 : 119 The drop is in the ocean, and the ocean is in the drop. Who understands, and knows this? 878 : 120 He Himself creates the wondrous play of the world. He Himself contemplates it, and understands its true essence. ||1|| −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 003 −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 003 15

Raag Raamkalee − Part 004 879 : 121 How rare are those who contemplate this spiritual wisdom. 879 : 122 Through this, the supreme state of liberation is attained. ||1||Pause|| 879 : 123 The night is in the day, and the day is in the night. The same is true of hot and cold. 879 : 124 No one else knows His state and extent; without the Guru, this is not understood. ||2|| 879 : 125 The female is in the male, and the male is in the female. Understand this, O God−realized being! 879 : 126 The meditation is in the music, and knowledge is in meditation. Become Gurmukh, and speak the Unspoken Speech. ||3|| 879 : 127 The Light is in the mind, and the mind is in the Light. The Guru brings the five senses together, like brothers. 879 : 128 Nanak is forever a sacrifice to those who enshrine love for the One Word of the Shabad. ||4||9|| 879 : 129 16

Raamkalee, First Mehl: 879 : 130 When the Lord God showered His Mercy, 879 : 131 egotism was eradicated from within me. 879 : 132 That humble servant who contemplates the Word of the Guru's Shabad, is very dear to the Lord. ||1|| 879 : 133 That humble servant of the Lord is pleasing to his Lord God; 879 : 134 day and night, he performs devotional worship, day and night. Disregarding his own honor, he sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 879 : 135 The unstruck melody of the sound current resonates and resounds; 879 : 136 my mind is appeased by the subtle essence of the Lord. 879 : 137 Through the Perfect Guru, I am absorbed in Truth. 879 : 138 Through the Guru, I have found the Lord, the Primal Being. ||2|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 004 17

879 : 139 Gurbani is the sound current of the Naad, the Vedas, everything. 879 : 140 My mind is attuned to the Lord of the Universe. 879 : 141 He is my sacred shrine of pilgrimage, fasting and austere self−discipline. 879 : 142 The Lord saves, and carries across, those who meet with the Guru. ||3|| 879 : 143 One whose self−conceit is gone, sees his fears run away. 879 : 144 That servant grasps the Guru's feet. 879 : 145 The Guru, the True Guru, has expelled my doubts. 879 : 146 Says Nanak, I have merged into the Word of the Shabad. ||4||10|| 879 : 147 Raamkalee, First Mehl: 879 : 148 He runs around, begging for clothes and food. Raag Raamkalee − Part 004 18

879 : 149 He burns with hunger and corruption, and will suffer in the world hereafter. 879 : 150 He does not follow the Guru's Teachings; through his evil−mindedness, he loses his honor. 879 : 151 Only through the Guru's Teachings will such a person become devoted. ||1|| 879 : 152 The way of the Yogi is to dwell in the celestial home of bliss. 879 : 153 He looks impartially, equally upon all. He receives the charity of the Lord's Love, and the Word of the Shabad, and so he is satisfied. ||1||Pause|| 879 : 154 The five bulls, the senses, pull the wagon of the body around. 879 : 155 By the Lord's power, one's honor is preserved. 879 : 156 But when the axle breaks, the wagon falls and crashes. 879 : 157 It falls apart, like a pile of logs. ||2|| 879 : 158 Contemplate the Word of the Guru's Shabad, Yogi. Raag Raamkalee − Part 004 19

879 : 159 Look upon pain and pleasure as one and the same, sorrow and separation. 879 : 160 Let your food be contemplative meditation upon the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 879 : 161 Your wall shall be permanent, by meditating on the Formless Lord. ||3|| 879 : 162 Wear the loin−cloth of poise, and be free of entanglements. 879 : 163 The Guru's Word shall release you from sexual desire and anger. 879 : 164 In your mind, let your ear−rings be the Sanctuary of the Guru, the Lord. 879 : 165 O Nanak, worshipping the Lord in deep devotion, the humble are carried across. ||4||11|| −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 004 −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 004 20

Raag Raamkalee − Part 005 880 : 166 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 880 : 167 Raamkalee, Third Mehl, First House: 880 : 168 In the Golden Age of Sat Yuga, everyone spoke the Truth. 880 : 169 In each and every home, devotional worship was performed by the people, according to the Guru's Teachings. 880 : 170 In that Golden Age, Dharma had four feet. 880 : 171 How rare are those people who, as Gurmukh, contemplate this and understand. ||1|| 880 : 172 In all four ages, the Naam, the Name of the Lord, is glory and greatness. 880 : 173 One who holds tight to the Naam is liberated; without the Guru, no one obtains the Naam. ||1||Pause|| 880 : 174 In the Silver Age of Traytaa Yuga, one leg was removed. 21

880 : 175 Hypocrisy became prevalent, and people thought that the Lord was far away. 880 : 176 The Gurmukhs still understood and realized; 880 : 177 the Naam abided deep within them, and they were at peace. ||2|| 880 : 178 In the Brass Age of Dwaapur Yuga, duality and double−mindedness arose. 880 : 179 Deluded by doubt, they knew duality. 880 : 180 In this Brass Age, Dharma was left with only two feet. 880 : 181 Those who became Gurmukh implanted the Naam deep within. ||3|| 880 : 182 In the Iron Age of Kali Yuga, Dharma was left with only one power. 880 : 183 It walks on just one foot; love and emotional attachment to Maya have increased. 880 : 184 Love and emotional attachment to Maya bring total darkness. Raag Raamkalee − Part 005 22

880 : 185 If someone meets the True Guru, he is saved, through the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||4|| 880 : 186 Throughout the ages, there is only the One True Lord. 880 : 187 Among all, is the True Lord; there is no other at all. 880 : 188 Praising the True Lord, true peace is attained. 880 : 189 How rare are those, who as Gurmukh, chant the Naam. ||5|| 880 : 190 Throughout all the ages, the Naam is the ultimate, the most sublime. 880 : 191 How rare are those, who as Gurmukh, understand this. 880 : 192 One who meditates on the Lord's Name is a humble devotee. 880 : 193 O Nanak, in each and every age, the Naam is glory and greatness. ||6||1|| 880 : 194 Raamkalee, Fourth Mehl, First House: Raag Raamkalee − Part 005 23

880 : 195 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 880 : 196 If someone is very fortunate, and is blessed with great high destiny, then he meditates on the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 880 : 197 Chanting the Naam, the Name of the Lord, he finds peace, and merges in the Naam. ||1|| 880 : 198 O mortal, as Gurmukh, worship the Lord in devotion forever. 880 : 199 Your heart shall be illumined; through the Guru's Teachings, lovingly attune yourself to the Lord. You shall merge in the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||1||Pause|| 880 : 200 The Great Giver is filled with diamonds, emeralds, rubies and pearls; 880 : 201 one who has good fortune and great destiny inscribed upon his forehead, digs them out, by following the Guru's Teachings. ||2|| 880 : 202 The Lord's Name is the jewel, the emerald, the ruby; digging it out, the Guru has placed it in your palm. 880 : 203 The unfortunate, self−willed manmukh does not obtain it; this priceless jewel remains hidden behind a curtain of straw. ||3|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 005 24

880 : 204 If such pre−ordained destiny is written upon one's forehead, then the True Guru enjoins him to serve Him. 880 : 205 O Nanak, then he obtains the jewel, the gem; blessed, blessed is that one who follows the Guru's Teachings, and finds the Lord. ||4||1|| 880 : 206 Raamkalee, Fourth Mehl: 880 : 207 Meeting with the humble servants of the Lord, I am in ecstasy; they preach the sublime sermon of the Lord. 880 : 208 The filth of evil−mindedness is totally washed away; joining the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, one is blessed with understanding. ||1|| −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 005 −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 005 25

Raag Raamkalee − Part 006 881 : 209 O humble servant of the Lord, follow the Guru's Teachings, and chant the Name of the Lord. 881 : 210 Whoever hears and speaks it is liberated; chanting the Lord's Name, one is embellished with beauty. ||1||Pause|| 881 : 211 If someone has supremely high destiny written on his forehead, the Lord leads him to meet the humble servants of the Lord. 881 : 212 Be merciful, and grant me the Blessed Vision of the Saints' Darshan, which shall rid me of all poverty and pain. ||2|| 881 : 213 The Lord's people are good and sublime; the unfortunate ones do not like them at all. 881 : 214 The more the Lord's exalted servants speak of Him, the more the slanderers attack and sting them. ||3|| 881 : 215 Cursed, cursed are the slanderers who do not like the humble, the friends and companions of the Lord. 881 : 216 Those who do not like the honor and glory of the Guru are faithless, black−faced thieves, who have turned their backs on the Lord. ||4|| 26

881 : 217 Have mercy, have mercy, please save me, Dear Lord. I am meek and humble − I seek Your protection. 881 : 218 I am Your child, and You are my father, God. Please forgive servant Nanak and merge him with Yourself. ||5||2|| 881 : 219 Raamkalee, Fourth Mehl: 881 : 220 The friends of the Lord, the humble, Holy Saints are sublime; the Lord spreads out His protecting hands above them. 881 : 221 The Gurmukhs are the Holy Saints, pleasing to God; in His mercy, He blends them with Himself. ||1|| 881 : 222 O Lord, my mind longs to meet with the humble servants of the Lord. 881 : 223 The sweet, subtle essence of the Lord is immortalizing ambrosia. Meeting the Saints, I drink it in. ||1||Pause|| 881 : 224 The Lord's people are the most lofty and exalted. Meeting with them, the most exalted status is obtained. 881 : 225 I am the slave of the slave of the Lord's slaves; my Lord and Master is pleased with me. ||2|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 006 27

881 : 226 The humble servant serves; one who enshrines love for the Lord in his heart, mind and body is very fortunate. 881 : 227 One who talks too much without love, speaks falsely, and obtains only false rewards. ||3|| 881 : 228 Take pity on me, O Lord of the World, O Great Giver; let me fall at the feet of the Saints. 881 : 229 I would cut off my head, and cut it into pieces, O Nanak, and set it down for the Saints to walk upon. ||4||3|| 881 : 230 Raamkalee, Fourth Mehl: 881 : 231 If I am blessed with supreme high destiny, I will meet the humble servants of the Lord, without delay. 881 : 232 The Lord's humble servants are pools of ambrosial nectar; by great good fortune, one bathes in them. ||1|| 881 : 233 O Lord, let me work for the humble servants of the Lord. 881 : 234 I carry water, wave the fan and grind the corn for them; I massage and wash their feet. I apply the dust of their feet to my forehead. ||1||Pause|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 006 28

881 : 235 The Lord's humble servants are great, very great, the greatest and most exalted; they lead us to meet the True Guru. 881 : 236 No one else is as great as the True Guru; meeting the True Guru, I meditate on the Lord, the Primal Being. ||2|| 881 : 237 Those who seek the Sanctuary of the True Guru find the Lord. My Lord and Master saves their honor. 881 : 238 Some come for their own purposes, and sit before the Guru; they pretend to be in Samaadhi, like storks with their eyes closed. ||3|| 881 : 239 Associating with the wretched and the lowly, like the stork and the crow, is like feeding on a carcass of poison. 881 : 240 Nanak: O God, unite me with the Sangat, the Congregation. United with the Sangat, I will become a swan. ||4||4|| −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 006 −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 006 29

Raag Raamkalee − Part 007 882 : 241 Raamkalee, Fourth Mehl: 882 : 242 O True Guru, please be kind, and unite me with the Lord. My Sovereign Lord is the Beloved of my breath of life. 882 : 243 I am a slave; I fall at the Guru's feet. He has shown me the Path, the Way to my Lord God. ||1|| 882 : 244 The Name of my Lord, Har, Har, is pleasing to my mind. 882 : 245 I have no friend except the Lord; the Lord is my father, my mother, my companion. ||1||Pause|| 882 : 246 My breath of life will not survive for an instant, without my Beloved; unless I see Him, I will die, O my mother! 882 : 247 Blessed, blessed is my great, high destiny, that I have come to the Guru's Sanctuary. Meeting with the Guru, I have obtained the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan. ||2|| 882 : 248 I do not know or understand any other within my mind; I meditate and chant the Lord's Chant. 30

882 : 249 Those who lack the Naam, wander in shame; their noses are chopped off, bit by bit. ||3|| 882 : 250 O Life of the World, rejuvenate me! O my Lord and Master, enshrine Your Name deep within my heart. 882 : 251 O Nanak, perfect is the Guru, the Guru. Meeting the True Guru, I meditate on the Naam. ||4||5|| 882 : 252 Raamkalee, Fourth Mehl: 882 : 253 The True Guru, the Great Giver, is the Great, Primal Being; meeting Him, the Lord is enshrined within the heart. 882 : 254 The Perfect Guru has granted me the life of the soul; I meditate in remembrance on the Ambrosial Name of the Lord. ||1|| 882 : 255 O Lord, the Guru has implanted the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, within my heart. 882 : 256 As Gurmukh, I have heard His sermon, which pleases my mind; blessed, blessed is my great destiny. ||1||Pause|| 882 : 257 Millions, three hundred thirty millions of gods meditate on Him, but they cannot find His end or limitation. Raag Raamkalee − Part 007 31

882 : 258 With sexual urges in their hearts, they beg for beautiful women; stretching out their hands, they beg for riches. ||2|| 882 : 259 One who chants the Praises of the Lord is the greatest of the great; the Gurmukh keeps the Lord clasped to his heart. 882 : 260 If one is blessed with high destiny, he meditates on the Lord, who carries him across the terrifying world−ocean. ||3|| 882 : 261 The Lord is close to His humble servant, and His humble servant is close to the Lord; He keeps His humble servant clasped to His Heart. 882 : 262 O Nanak, the Lord God is our father and mother. I am His child; the Lord cherishes me. ||4||6||18|| 882 : 263 Raag Raamkalee, Fifth Mehl, First House: 882 : 264 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 882 : 265 Have mercy on me, O Generous Giver, Lord of the meek; please do not consider my merits and demerits. 882 : 266 How can dust be washed? O my Lord and Master, such is the state of mankind. ||1|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 007 32

882 : 267 O my mind, serve the True Guru, and be at peace. 882 : 268 Whatever you desire, you shall receive that reward, and you shall not be afflicted by pain any longer. ||1||Pause|| 882 : 269 He creates and adorns the earthen vessels; He infuses His Light within them. 882 : 270 As is the destiny pre−ordained by the Creator, so are the deeds we do. ||2|| 882 : 271 He believes the mind and body are all his own; this is the cause of his coming and going. 882 : 272 He does not think of the One who gave him these; he is blind, entangled in emotional attachment. ||3|| −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 007 −− Raag Raamkalee − Part 007 33

Raag Raamkalee − Part 008 883 : 273 One who knows that God created him, reaches the Incomparable Mansion of the Lord's Presence. 883 : 274 Worshipping the Lord, I sing His Glorious Praises. Nanak is Your slave. ||4||1|| 883 : 275 Raamkalee, Fifth Mehl: 883 : 276 Place yourself beneath all men's feet, and you will be uplifted; serve Him in this way. 883 : 277 Know that all are above you, and you shall find peace in the Court of the Lord. ||1|| 883 : 278 O Saints, speak that speech which purifies the gods and sanctifies the divine beings. As Gurmukh, chant the Word of His Bani, even for an instant. ||1||Pause|| 883 : 279 Renounce your fraudulent plans, and dwell in the celestial palace; do not call anyone else false. 883 : 280 Meeting with the True Guru, you shall receive the nine treasures; in this way, you shall find the essence of reality. ||2|| 883 : 281 34

Eradicate doubt, and as Gurmukh, enshrine love for the Lord; understand your own soul, O Siblings of Destiny. 883 : 282 Know that God is near at hand, and ever−present. How could you try to hurt anyone else? ||3|| 883 : 283 Meeting with the True Guru, your path shall be clear, and you shall easily meet your Lord and Master. 883 : 284 Blessed, blessed are those humble beings, who, in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, find the Lord. Nanak is forever a sacrifice to them. ||4||2|| 883 : 285 Raamkalee, Fifth Mehl: 883 : 286 Coming does not please me, and going does not bring me pain, and so my mind is not afflicted by disease. 883 : 287 I am in bliss forever, for I have found the Perfect Guru; my separation from the Lord is totally ended. ||1|| 883 : 288 This is how I have joined my mind to the Lord. 883 : 289 Attachment, sorrow, disease and public opinion do not affect me, and so, I enjoy the subtle essence of the Lord, Har, Har, Har. ||1||Pause|| Raag Raamkalee − Part 008 35

883 : 290 I am pure in the heavenly realm, pure on this earth, and pure in the nether regions of the underworld. I remain apart from the people of the world. 883 : 291 Obedient to the Lord, I enjoy peace forever; wherever I look, I see the Lord of glorious virtues. ||2|| 883 : 292 There is no Shiva or Shakti, no energy or matter, no water or wind, no world of form there, 883 : 293 where the True Guru, the Yogi, dwells, where the Imperishable Lord God, the Unapproachable Master abides. ||3|| 883 : 294 Body and mind belong to the Lord; all wealth belongs to the Lord; what glorious virtues of the Lord can I describe? 883 : 295 Says Nanak, the Guru has destroyed my sense of 'mine and yours'. Like water with water, I am blended with God. ||4||3|| 883 : 296 Raamkalee, Fifth Mehl: 883 : 297 It is beyond the three qualities; it remains untouched. The seekers and Siddhas do not know it. 883 : 298 Raag Raamkalee − Part 008 36

There is a chamber filled with jewels, overflowing with Ambrosial Nectar, in the Guru's Treasury. ||1|| 883 : 299 This thing is wonderful and amazing! It cannot be described. 883 : 300 It is an unfathomable object, O Siblings of Destiny! ||1||Pause|| 883 : 301 Its value cannot be estimated at all; what can anyone say about it? 883 : 302 By speaking and describing it, it cannot be understood; only one who sees it realizes it. ||2|| 883 : 303 Only the Creator Lord knows it; what can any poor creature do? 883 : 304 Only He Himself knows His own state and extent.
